title: Herbed White Bean Breakfast Toast
description: A savory open-faced toast topped with creamy herbed white beans, lemon, and bright herbs for a fresh breakfast or light lunch. Toasted bread provides crunch while garlic, olive oil and a touch of chile flakes round out the flavors.

ingredients.display_name: canned cannellini (white) beans, drained and rinsed
ingredients.notes: approx. one 15 oz (425 g) can drained to ~240 g
use good quality for finishing and cooking

ingredients.display_name: crumbled cherry tomatoes or diced tomato
ingredients.notes: halved cherry tomatoes or one small tomato diced

ingredients.display_name: microgreens or baby arugula for garnish
optional grated vegan parmesan or crumbled feta
ingredients.notes: vegan or dairy option; if using dairy, allergen present changes

steps.text: Drain and rinse the canned cannellini beans and place them in a medium bowl; reserve a small splash of the can liquid if needed for texture.

In a small skillet over medium heat, warm half the olive oil and add the minced garlic; saut√© briefly until fragrant but not browned (approximate color change), about one minute, then remove from heat to avoid bitterness.

Add the warm garlic oil, lemon juice, chopped parsley, thyme (if using), diced red onion, salt, black pepper and chile flakes to the bowl with beans. Lightly mash the mixture with a fork or potato masher until you reach a creamy-but-slightly-textured spread.
Taste and adjust seasoning, adding a splash of reserved bean liquid or a little more olive oil if too thick; keep mixture warm or at room temperature while toasting bread.
Toast the bread slices until golden and crisp using a toaster or oven broiler set 6 inches from heat; brush or drizzle remaining olive oil on toasted slices for flavor and texture.
Divide the herbed white bean mash evenly across the toasted bread slices, spreading to cover the surface; top with halved cherry tomatoes or diced tomato if using.
Garnish with microgreens or baby arugula and optional grated vegan parmesan or crumbled feta; finish with a light drizzle of olive oil and an extra squeeze of lemon if desired before serving.
Serve immediately while toast is crisp. Leftover bean spread can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
